thread.title: 4 arrested with Rs 49 lakh in demonetised banknotes
thread.title_full: 4 arrested with Rs 49 lakh in demonetised banknotes

author: PTI
title: 4 arrested with Rs 49 lakh in demonetised banknotes
text:
4 arrested with Rs 49 lakh in demonetised banknotes 4 arrested with Rs 49 lakh in demonetised banknotes They have been identified as Ankur of Punjabi Bagh in Delhi, Sanjay of Surya Nagar in Ghaziabad and Dilshad and Sleem Khan of Seemapuri in East Delhi. By: PTI | Ghaziabad   3:33 AM Four persons have been arrested with Rs 49 lakh in demonetised banknotes of Rs 500 and Rs 1,000. (PTI) 
Four persons have been arrested with Rs 49 lakh in demonetised banknotes of Rs 500 and Rs 1,000, police said today. 
Senior Superintendent of Police (SSP) Deepak Kumar said the arrests were made yesterday from Ram Manohar Lohiya Park in Rajendra Nagar based on a tip-off. 
They have been identified as Ankur of Punjabi Bagh in Delhi, Sanjay of Surya Nagar in Ghaziabad and Dilshad and Sleem Khan of Seemapuri in East Delhi. 
You may also like to watch this video : 
A Maruti car has also been seized in which they ferried the currency from Delhi to Ghaziabad. Police said the four were waiting for an agent who would get the money exchanged when they were arrested. 
The SSP said efforts were on to unearth the entire racket in which non-resident Indians (NRIs) are also involved. While the deadline for exchanging old notes for Indians has expired, NRIs will be able to exchange demonetised Rs 500 and Rs 1,000 notes at RBI offices till 30 June.
